body: The only X11 clipboard implementation in Rust is GPL licensed; no way can we use that. A new implementation based off resources like https://www.jwz.org/doc/x-cut-and-paste.html and the [ICCCM](https://tronche.com/gui/x/icccm/) will need to be written.

rename.to: Implement X11 clipboard pasting referencing ICCCM

body: We now have paste support on X11 by shelling out to xclip. This is obviously less than ideal, but at least there's pasting. less than ideal = massive hack ;)

Just thought I'd share [rust-clipboard](https://github.com/aweinstock314/rust-clipboard) used by Mozilla Servo. It's Apache-2.0 licensed.

I don't think it can be used directly but its in-code comments offer insight into ICCCM atoms and selections in X11

Thanks for the suggestions! If it's the same library I looked at, the X11 portion was actually GPL licensed. Servo removed clipboard support at some point because of it.

I'll take another look this weekend.
Oh, you're right. They borrowed code from xclip which is GPLv2 :(

Have you looked into `xsel` code?

It appears to be using a permissive, custom license that should be compatible.

http://www.vergenet.net/~conrad/software/xsel/#License

@mrak Hadn't looked into that! We still would want a Rust implementation of it. Maybe deriving one from the `xsel` implementation would be possible with that license. Probably easier than going through ICCCM.
The inability to copy-paste continues to be a chronic annoyance on Linux, and I see @quininer  implemented something that may address this. Are there any plans to merge it into the main releases?
The PR from quininer should be good, but if you want copy/paste right now, you can use `xclip` for that. From a user-perspective it shoud work just fine on linux right now.

@chrisduerr Could you elaborate on this? I have tried `xclip`  and `autocutsel` with various parameters, but never got sane Copy+Paste to work. All I want is to paste entries from parcellite to alacritty.
